channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Child dies in stabbing at Croatian primary school
item.description: The alleged attacker has been arrested, police say.

item.title: Thousands of Jews have left Israel since the October 7 attacks
item.description: There's concern about whether emigration after Oct. 7, 2023 will drive a "brain drain" in sectors like medicine and tech.

item.title: Two journalists killed in northern Syria
item.description: A journalists' association says two journalists working for Kurdish media outlets were killed in Syria while covering fighting between Turkish-backed ...

item.title: Official says Wisconsin shooter was new student at Christian school where her victims had deep ties
item.description: An official at the Wisconsin school where a student shot and killed a teacher and a fellow student says the 15-year-old was in her first semester ther...

item.title: 'Bill of the Month': The series that dissects and slashes medical bills
item.description: Since 2018, readers and listeners sent KFF Health News-NPR's "Bill of the Month" thousands of questionable bills. Our crowdsourced investigation paved...

item.title: How Trump could undo portions of Biden's climate legacy
item.description: Biden's most recent climate initiatives are all but certain to be short-lived, mostly thanks to an obscure law that tends to come into play every four...

item.title: Saturday is the winter solstice. Make the most of the shortest day of the year
item.description: Saturday marks the shortest day of the year and the official start of winter in the Northern Hemisphere. NPR has compiled plenty of expert tips for ce...

item.title: Stuffing stockings with skincare? Here's what kids should and shouldn't be using
item.description: Skin care is all the rage​ for teens and tweens these days, but be careful not to give products that could cause more harm than good.

item.title: Big Lots says it is having going-out-of-business sales as it seeks a new buyer
item.description: The national discount retailer says that a previously announced deal to sell itself to a private-equity group fell through.

item.title: Malaysia approves new search for missing flight MH370
item.description: The Boeing 777 carrying 239 people vanished 10 years ago in one of aviation's greatest mysteries.

item.title: Hungary sparks row with Poland by granting asylum to ex-minister
item.description: Marcin Romanowski is facing 11 charges in Poland, including being accused of defrauding the state.

item.title: Man accused in UnitedHealthcare CEO killing faces federal charge that’s eligible for death penalty
Louisiana forbids public health workers from promoting COVID, flu and mpox shots
item.description: An NPR investigation found Louisiana health officials told staff to stop promoting vaccines for COVID, flu and mpox, holding flu shot events or otherw...

item.title: History has never ended, but are we at a crossroads again?
item.description: Oxford professor Ben Ansell says we are witnessing a battle between nationalism and liberalism that will write our own time indelibly into the history...

item.title: News details emerge about Utah mom, 3 kids killed at their home
item.description: One child survived being shot in the head and is hospitalized with a severe brain injury, police said.

item.title: Eight migrants drown after boat tries to evade Greek ship
item.description: So far 18 people have been rescued from the sea with many of the survivors suffering from injuries after the incident.

item.title: Trump-backed bill to keep US government running fails to pass
item.description: Dozens of Republicans defied Trump and tech billionaire Elon Musk by joining Democrats to reject a revised spending bill.

item.title: International students urged to return to US campuses before Trump inauguration
